alert.note: Alert for Northern Oglala Lakota; Southern Oglala Lakota (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 9:13AM MST until January 13 at 11:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, widespread blowing snow is expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northern Oglala Lakota County and Southern Oglala Lakota County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Pine Ridge Reservation. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon to 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 8 PM MST /9 PM CST/ this evening to 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Late tonight, strong north to northwest winds will bring blowing snow and significantly reduced visibilities, leading to hazardous travel conditions. Near-blizzard conditions will be possible at times. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Even if you are outdoors for just a few minutes, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Northern Oglala Lakota; Southern Oglala Lakota
